name: Advanced Custom Order Status for WooCommerce
author: StorePlugin

sections.description:
The Advanced Custom Order Status for WooCommerce plugin is a must-have tool for WooCommerce store owners who want to have complete control over their order statuses.

Users can easily create, edit, and delete order statuses that align with their business needs. Additionally, the ability to add icons and colors to order statuses enhances the visual representation of the order status, making it more engaging for both the store owner and the customer.

Key features:

  • Customize, delete, and add new order statuses in WooCommerce.
  • Enhance the appearance of order statuses by adding colors.

Premium features:

  • Replace text with icons to make order statuses more visually appealing.
  • Assign any order status to the order action.
  • Position order statuses anywhere you prefer.
  • Specify the type of order status you want to set.
  • Add order status in bulk action on order page.
  • Show sale report of a order status you need.
  • Automatically send email notifications upon changing the order status.
sections.installation:
The Plugin installation process in WordPress is very easy and convenient. Simply follow the steps below to get started.

e.g.

  1. Upload advanced-custom-order-status-for-woocommerce to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
  3. Click on settings link and enjoy the feature.
sections.faq:
What is the maximum number of order statuses that I can create?

Only sky is the limit.

Is it possible to customize the default order status?

Sure! It’s possible excluding the slug.

Is it possible to change multiple order statuses at once using bulk action?

yes! you can add any order status in bulk action.

  2. WooCommerce Order Page.

  3. Order Status Settings.
sections.reviews:
Very helpful plugin to change WooCommerce order status.

By zubair030996 on November 20, 2023

Could you guys add the ajax solution for creating the order slug in the plugin?
